p: It is known that the prognosis of athletes with uncomplicated acute myocarditis and with a complete recovery, including normalized left ventricular function and absence of late gadolinium enhancement, is highly favourable. 31,32 Still, in athletes recovering from COVID-19, even without pre-existing diseases, the development of cardiovascular complications and long-term consequences, e.g. arrhythmias, must be taken into consideration and should be ruled out by means of a careful follow-up. In the near future, data about treatment and monitoring of athletes recovering from COVID-19 will be of major importance. Above all, specifically against the background of the wide spectrum of COVID-19 disease manifestations, the questions of eligibility for sport and long-term consequences of COVID-19 for athletes should be addressed.
